entries.value: Barney Bigard, Otto Hardwick, Johnny Hodges out. Duke Ellington(hand drum instead of p).

entries.content:
The first and second titles were copyrighted and published as "When My Sugar Walks Down The Street (All The Little Birdies Go Tweet-Tweet-Tweet)." and "You Gave Me The Gate (And I'm Swingin')" respectively.

On most of Pyramid, Greer plays a tom-tom and Ellington an improvised hand drum, made out of a tambourine, without the tinkles, and a cardboard cylinder.
